page.title: 08CAIRNEYHILL SCHOOL
page.content: Cairneyhill Primary School was opened in 1981, being extended in 1984. Before 1981 pupils shared a school, built about a mile away in 1924, with children from Crossford village. The present school population is{242,} there being{141}boys and{101}girls, and the school's 9 classes are catered for by 8 permanent teachers, 1 auxiliary teacher, a part-time teacher and a teacher to help those with learning difficulties. The catchment area of the school includes the rapidly growing village of Cairneyhill and the surrounding farms, and pupils are bussed to Queen Anne High School for their secondary education. The school, which is largely open plan in design, also has a community centre wing which is open until 10pm. every day of the week.(see page 9)
